data.text: @N_J_Bennett @RMcdiddly @NSWHealth Ok we'll check in in a few months. One of us will eat humble pie

@Bunz210 @RMcdiddly @NSWHealth The management has demonstrated over and over that they are incapable of understanding, let alone managing, the unfolding pandemic. Epidemiologists and virologists don't have consensus that immunity will be long-lasting or work for new variants. Stay tuned for more mayhem...

@N_J_Bennett @RMcdiddly @NSWHealth The experts said that in Dec last year. The consensus view now is that it is playing out that way. That's why our govt and their health panel has taken masks off and soon to follow with irrelevant vaccine mandates and recognition of previous recovered infection
@Bunz210 @RMcdiddly @NSWHealth The experts think it may or may not happen. It seems foolish to depend on it happening.

@N_J_Bennett @RMcdiddly @NSWHealth Sure but what you're saying is this won't happen. No?

Statistically, for young healthy covid naive, covid recovered, vaccinated people, this is playing out to be benign. This itself is a powerful weapon against this virus and should be leveraged
@Bunz210 @RMcdiddly @NSWHealth "it needs to be determined if it will be long or short like colds"

@N_J_Bennett @RMcdiddly @NSWHealth Here's a paper regarding reinfection and severe disease. Published in the New England Journal of Medicine December last year. Enjoy! https://t.co/HsFU0scogP https://t.co/vLVoXpKBr3

@Bunz210 @RMcdiddly @NSWHealth I don't completely, it's a complex question. But, we get multiple colds every year because we don't mount a long lasting response. No evidence covid immunity is long, so let's not plan on it.
https://t.co/FF3Ydstjja

@N_J_Bennett @RMcdiddly @NSWHealth Take a look at Sweden and Florida. It's no fantasy. In your world you completely discount the human body's ability to cope with it. It's true natural immunity won't work with the elderly and vulnerable because their immune systems don't work. It's always been that way.
